title: Claude Code 2.1.32: Opus 4.6 and Agent Teams
description: Claude Code 2.1.32 released on February 5, 2026, integrating Claude Opus 4.6 with Agent Teams feature in research preview for multi-agent collaboration. Includes performance improvements: lower memory usage, faster session resumes, and better PDF handling. This follows the massive 2.1.0 release in January with 1,096 commits and 80+ features including Shift+Enter for newlines, Skills hot reload, and session teleportation.

community_feedback.quote: Claude Code 2.1.32 regression - allocates ~11GB RAM on startup
We tasked Opus 4.6 using agent teams to build a C Compiler

title: Claude Opus 4.6 Fast Mode Public Preview
description: GitHub Copilot introduced fast mode for Claude Opus 4.6 in public preview on February 7, 2026, delivering 2.5x faster token speeds with the same frontier intelligence. Promotional pricing available February 7-16, 2026. This follows the February 5 general availability of Claude Opus 4.6 with 1M token context, agent teams, and 128K max output.

community_feedback.quote: Claude Opus 4.6 feels very different, inference seems slow but the adaptive thinking feature is notable

title: Claude Opus 4.6 Generally Available
description: GitHub Copilot announced general availability of Claude Opus 4.6 on February 5, 2026, featuring 1 million token context window, agent teams multi-agent collaboration, 128K token maximum output, and improved planning for agentic tasks.

community_feedback.quote: Claude Opus 4.6 is now available on GitHub Copilot. Let the coding begin!

title: GPT-5.3-Codex General Availability
description: GPT-5.3-Codex became generally available for GitHub Copilot on February 9, 2026, alongside GitHub Apps improvements. The Copilot CLI also added support for Claude Opus 4.6 Fast Preview with markdown formatting in non-interactive mode.

title: Claude Opus 4.6 Integration
description: Windsurf integrated Claude Opus 4.6 on February 5, 2026, Anthropic's latest model with 1M token context window, agent teams support, and enhanced agentic coding capabilities. Promotional pricing available: 2x credits (without thinking mode) and 3x credits (with thinking mode) for self-serve users. Multiple patch releases (1.9544.26-1.9544.28) in early February focused on bug fixes and Arena Mode improvements.

community_feedback.quote: Is anyone else getting really frustrated with Windsurf lately?

title: Version 0.96.0 with GPT-5.3-Codex Support
description: Codex CLI v0.96.0 released on February 4, 2026, adding performance improvements and full support for GPT-5.3-Codex model integration. Users need to update CLI, IDE extension, or Codex app to access the new model. Previous version 0.93.0 added SOCKS5 proxy listener on January 30, 2026.

title: Version 0.27.0 UI Improvements
description: Gemini CLI v0.27.0 released on February 2, 2026, featuring clean UI transition with removed input prompt box border and improved user interface. This follows v0.26.0 from January 26, 2026, which introduced Agent Skills to extend functionality and added Hooks feature with fixed PDF token estimation issues.

title: Version 2.4.28-2.4.30 Patch Releases
description: Cursor released multiple patch versions (2.4.28-2.4.30) in early February 2026 following the major 2.4 release. However, these updates introduced several issues including broken SSH binaries for remote Windows SSH, line ending changes across entire codebases, memory crashes during large prompts, Jupyter kernel problems, and general instability leading some users to roll back to version 2.4.27.

community_feedback.quote: Cursor 2.4.28 Patch Causes Remote Windows SSH Issues - users had to roll back to Cursor 2.4.27 due to broken SSH binary
I'm going to just stop updating Cursor

title: Scheduled Devins Feature
description: Devin AI released Scheduled Devins feature on February 3, 2026, allowing users to create recurring Devin sessions that run automatically on a schedule without manual intervention. This enables automation of repetitive development tasks and autonomous coding workflows with configurable frequency and timing.

title: Version 0.86.0 with GPT-5 Support
description: Aider v0.86.0 added comprehensive support for GPT-5 model with expanded multi-model compatibility across family variants and providers (OpenAI, Azure, OpenRouter), including dated and chat/mini/nano variants. Aider wrote 88% of the code in this release. Recent versions (0.85.x) also added support for GPT-5 reasoning_effort settings, Grok-4, and Gemini 2.5 Flash Lite models.

title: Shareable Agents and Code Review Inbox
description: Continue v1.5.34 released on January 9, 2026, introducing shareable agents with publicly shareable links and extra instructions for just-in-time prompts, along with code review inbox features for filtering pull requests and solving failing checks, merge conflicts, and review comments. This follows v1.0.38 from November 2025 which added GPT-5 Codex support, instant edits, and Grok Code Fast 1 integration.
